lead: This week in tech highlights the rapid deployment of AI in businesses, Curl's decision to end its bug bounty program, and notable product reviews including new smartphones and laptops.

stories.title: Curl shutters bug bounty program to remove incentive for submitting AI slop
stories.summary: Curl has decided to end its bug bounty program, citing concerns over low-quality AI submissions that do not meet their standards.

stories.title: Businesses are deploying AI agents faster than safety protocols can keep up, Deloitte says
stories.summary: Deloitte's report warns that the rapid deployment of AI agents in workplaces is outpacing the establishment of necessary safety protocols, raising significant risks.

stories.title: I changed 10 settings on my Samsung phone to significantly improve the performance
stories.summary: Tweaking settings on Samsung phones can lead to significant performance improvements, enhancing user experience without needing new hardware.

stories.title: Sony and TCL are teaming up to make your next TV, and it's a bigger deal than you think
stories.summary: Sony and TCL's partnership will see TCL taking control of Sony's TV division by 2027, marking a significant shift in the television market.

stories.title: Elon Musk Makes Part of X Algorithm Open Source, Says It ‘Sucks’
stories.summary: Elon Musk has made parts of the X algorithm open source, expressing his dissatisfaction with its current state and calling it 'dumb'.
